questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: An ice cream shop uses 4 liters of ice cream to make 16 cones. If the shop plans to sell 80 cones and expects to lose 0.25 liters of ice cream to melting/waste for each batch of 16 cones, how many liters should they buy in total?

content_zh.stem: An ice cream shop uses 4 liters of ice cream to make 16 cones. If the shop plans to sell 80 cones and expects to lose 0.25 liters of ice cream to melting/waste for each batch of 16 cones, how many liters should they buy in total?

questions.explanation_en: Batches needed: 80 ÷ 16 = 5. Ice cream: 4 × 5 = 20L. Waste: 0.25 × 5 = 1.25L. Total: 20 + 1.25 = 21.25L.
questions.explanation_zh: Batches needed: 80 ÷ 16 = 5. Ice cream: 4 × 5 = 20L. Waste: 0.25 × 5 = 1.25L. Total: 20 + 1.25 = 21.25L.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G7-MATH-001 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: What is the correct order for the time measurements from smallest to largest? 1/6 of a day, 3.5 hours, 250 minutes, 6000 seconds
options: A. 1/6 of a day, 3.5 hours, 250 minutes, 6000 seconds
B. 6000 seconds, 3.5 hours, 250 minutes, 1/6 of a day
C. 6000 seconds, 3.5 hours, 1/6 of a day, 250 minutes
D. 250 minutes, 6000 seconds, 3.5 hours, 1/6 of a day

content_zh.stem: What is the correct order for the time measurements from smallest to largest? 1/6 of a day, 3.5 hours, 250 minutes, 6000 seconds
options: A. 1/6 of a day, 3.5 hours, 250 minutes, 6000 seconds
B. 6000 seconds, 3.5 hours, 250 minutes, 1/6 of a day
C. 6000 seconds, 3.5 hours, 1/6 of a day, 250 minutes
D. 250 minutes, 6000 seconds, 3.5 hours, 1/6 of a day

content_en.stem: Use the graph to answer: What is the unit rate per crate? (Graph shows time vs. number of crates picked)

content_zh.stem: Use the graph to answer: What is the unit rate per crate? (Graph shows time vs. number of crates picked)

questions.explanation_en: Reading the graph at x=1 crate shows y=3 minutes, establishing the unit rate of 3 minutes per crate.
questions.explanation_zh: Reading the graph at x=1 crate shows y=3 minutes, establishing the unit rate of 3 minutes per crate.

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A recipe calls for 3 cups of flour to make 24 cookies. If Maria wants to make 60 cookies for a bake sale, how many cups of flour does she need?

content_zh.stem: A recipe calls for 3 cups of flour to make 24 cookies. If Maria wants to make 60 cookies for a bake sale, how many cups of flour does she need?

questions.explanation_en: Set up the proportion: 3/24 = x/60. Cross multiply: 24x = 180. Divide: x = 7.5 cups.
questions.explanation_zh: Set up the proportion: 3/24 = x/60. Cross multiply: 24x = 180. Divide: x = 7.5 cups.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G7-MATH-101 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: On a map, 1 inch represents 15 miles. Two cities are 4.5 inches apart on the map. If a car travels at 45 miles per hour, how long will the trip take?

content_zh.stem: On a map, 1 inch represents 15 miles. Two cities are 4.5 inches apart on the map. If a car travels at 45 miles per hour, how long will the trip take?

questions.explanation_en: Actual distance: 4.5 × 15 = 67.5 miles. Time = distance/speed = 67.5/45 = 1.5 hours.
questions.explanation_zh: Actual distance: 4.5 × 15 = 67.5 miles. Time = distance/speed = 67.5/45 = 1.5 hours.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G7-MATH-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A circular garden has a diameter of 14 meters. What is the area of the garden? (Use pi = 22/7)

content_zh.stem: A circular garden has a diameter of 14 meters. What is the area of the garden? (Use pi = 22/7)

questions.explanation_en: Radius = 14/2 = 7 m. Area = pi × r² = (22/7) × 49 = 154 m².
questions.explanation_zh: Radius = 14/2 = 7 m. Area = pi × r² = (22/7) × 49 = 154 m².
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G7-MATH-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A right rectangular prism is sliced with a plane that passes through it at an angle, cutting through all four lateral faces. What shape is the cross-section?

content_zh.stem: A right rectangular prism is sliced with a plane that passes through it at an angle, cutting through all four lateral faces. What shape is the cross-section?

questions.explanation_en: An angled plane cutting through all four lateral faces of a rectangular prism creates a parallelogram cross-section.
questions.explanation_zh: An angled plane cutting through all four lateral faces of a rectangular prism creates a parallelogram cross-section.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G7-MATH-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)
